|Title=Knowing how testicular function changes with age
|Description=None
|Topic=Physiopathology
|Contributors=Benjamin Pradere
|Order=16}}

During the ageing process, testosterone secretion by the Leydig cells decreases, as a result of a reduction in steroidogenesis as a whole. The impairment is also central, with a reduction in GnRH secretion. In addition, androgen receptors are reduced on the surface of all the cells in the target tissues, increasing the symptoms associated with hypo secretion of testosterone.

properties.question: How does testicular function change with age according to the provided content?
properties.option_a: Testosterone secretion by Leydig cells increases due to enhanced steroidogenesis.
properties.option_b: There is no change in testosterone secretion, but androgen receptors increase in number on target tissue cells.
properties.option_c: Testosterone secretion by Leydig cells decreases due to a reduction in steroidogenesis and GnRH secretion.
properties.option_d: Testosterone secretion is unaffected, but there is an increase in the sensitivity of androgen receptors.
